P.title: Will the US government increase funding for nuclear safety research by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US government has officially increased funding for nuclear safety research compared to the funding levels of 2024. The increase must be documented in an official budget proposal or appropriations bill passed by Congress. The increase must be at least 10% above the 2024 funding level for nuclear safety research as defined by the Department of Energy and the Nuclear Regulatory Commission. Any funding increases that are temporary, one-time allocations, or related to specific projects without ongoing commitment do not count towards this resolution.

Q.title: Will there be a major public safety incident related to nuclear facilities in the US before 2025?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, any of the following occurs: (1) a significant nuclear incident classified as a Level 3 or higher on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES) occurs at a nuclear facility in the US, resulting in public exposure to radiation or a public safety alert; (2) a major security breach at a nuclear facility that leads to a credible threat to public safety, as reported by a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post); (3) an event causing a substantial evacuation or emergency response related to a nuclear facility, officially recognized by government agencies such as the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC). Minor incidents or routine safety drills do not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will the US Senate pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?

reasons: Increased funding for nuclear safety research may be a response to perceived risks or incidents related to nuclear facilities, indicating a potential correlation between the two events.
A major public safety incident could prompt the government to allocate more resources towards nuclear safety research to prevent future occurrences, thus linking the two questions logically.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions due to their potential interrelatedness in the context of public safety and government funding decisions.

P.title: Will Ukraine achieve a membership action plan with NATO by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Ukraine is officially granted a Membership Action Plan (MAP) by NATO. The decision must be confirmed through an official NATO announcement or documentation. The criteria for a MAP include Ukraine's demonstrated commitment to the principles of democracy, individual liberty, and the rule of law, as well as its ability to contribute to NATO's collective defense. Any interim agreements or discussions will not count towards this resolution unless they culminate in an official MAP grant. The resolution will also account for any significant political changes or events that may affect NATO's decision-making process regarding Ukraine's membership aspirations.

Q.title: Will NATO expand its presence in Eastern Europe before Ukraine joins?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if NATO officially announces an expansion of its military presence in Eastern Europe before Ukraine is granted full NATO membership. The announcement must be made through a credible source such as an official NATO press release or a statement from a high-ranking NATO official. The expansion must involve the deployment of additional troops, military bases, or significant military resources in Eastern European member states. The question will resolve as No if Ukraine joins NATO before any such announcement is made, regardless of any discussions or plans that may have been proposed prior to that date.

reasons: Both questions relate to NATO's strategic decisions regarding Ukraine, making their outcomes potentially interdependent.

If Ukraine is granted a Membership Action Plan (MAP), it may influence NATO's decision to expand its presence in Eastern Europe, as it could be seen as a step towards further integration and support for Ukraine.
Understanding the timeline of NATO's expansion and Ukraine's MAP could provide insights into the geopolitical landscape in Eastern Europe, especially in the context of ongoing tensions with Russia.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is relevant and worth considering due to their interconnected nature in the context of NATO's strategy and regional security dynamics.
